summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS structure contains codes indicating the status of DVD-Video playback. These codes are used in the method.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.hrVPEStatus
member.summary: Overlay/VPE error code. Zero indicates success; any other value is failure.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.bDvdVolInvalid
member.summary: TRUE if the specified DVD volume to be played does not exist; FALSE otherwise.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.bDvdVolUnknown
member.summary: TRUE if no DVD volume is specified or if it isn't found; FALSE otherwise.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.bNoLine21In
member.summary: TRUE if the video decoder doesn't produce line 21 (closed captioning) data; FALSE otherwise.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.bNoLine21Out
member.summary: TRUE if the video decoder can't be shown as closed captioning on video due to a problem with graph building; FALSE otherwise.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.iNumStreams
member.summary: Number of DVD streams to render.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.iNumStreamsFailed
member.summary: Number of streams that failed to render.

member.name: AM_DVD_RENDERSTATUS.dwFailedStreamsFlag
member.summary: Combination of flags indicating which streams failed.
